title: Figma Unveils Three AI-Powered Tools for Precision Image Editing on Canvas

paragraphs.content: Figma launched three new AI-powered image editing tools—Erase object, Isolate object, and Expand image—on December 10, 2025, enabling users to perform precise edits directly within Figma Design and Draw. These tools integrate into a revamped image editing toolbar that consolidates features like Remove background and Crop, prioritizing high-usage functions for streamlined workflows. Available to Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plan users with AI enabled, they eliminate the need for exporting to external software like Photoshop.

paragraphs.content: The tools emphasize granular control without text prompts, using an improved lasso selection for tasks like object removal or background extension. A Figma YouTube demo highlights their efficiency for cleaning up images and adapting assets across formats without leaving the canvas. They complement existing AI features, positioning Figma as a complete creative hub for designers and marketers.

sections.title: Revamped Toolbar Unifies AI Editing Capabilities

paragraphs.content: Figma's new toolbar centralizes image editing tools, placing Remove background prominently due to its frequent use among designers for UI mockups and brand consistency. Users can now select objects with Lasso 2.0 to erase elements seamlessly or isolate subjects while preserving background color and characteristics. This consolidation supports precise manipulations like applying blur, lighting, or shadow effects directly on the canvas.

paragraphs.content: The release notes detail over 150 features added in 2025, with these tools enhancing drawing and prototyping alongside AI image generation using models like Gemini 3.0 Pro. Community plugins like Bria AI extend one-click editing options, focusing on high-impact creative work. Rollout began in Design and Draw, with expansion planned across Figma products in 2026.

paragraphs.content: ContentGrip praises the tools for minimizing platform switches, allowing marketers to handle visual tweaks in campaigns without design team handoffs. TechCrunch notes Figma catching up to Adobe and Canva's long-standing object removal features, launched amid Adobe's ChatGPT integrations. Designers in YouTube tutorials call the tools "INSANE" for eliminating Photoshop dependencies on precise selections.

paragraphs.content: Figma positions these updates to close workflow loops for product shots and mockups, with future API support for enterprise batch processing. Industry views predict faster iterations in cross-functional reviews and design-stage optimizations. Expansion to broader AI ecosystems like Figma Make could enable no-code photo editing apps.
